output.analysis:
Let's analyze this post according to our criteria:
1. Has CMF: Yes, contains "CMF: 11240015" at the end 2. Refers to candidates: Yes, specifically mentions Marcel Ciolacu and Ciucă, who are presidential candidates 3. Addresses wide population: Yes, it's a paid Facebook/Instagram post targeting 100,001-500,000 people 4. Electoral objective: Yes, it explicitly mentions the upcoming elections ("alegeri peste 3 zile") and attempts to influence voting behavior 5. Journalism: No, this is not journalistic content but rather political messaging 6. Personal opinion: No, this is an organized political message from USR Constanța
The post contains direct electoral messaging, criticizing PSD-PNL and their presidential candidates (Ciolacu and Ciucă) while encouraging people to vote against them. The timing (3 days before elections) and the presence of a CMF number confirms this is electoral propaganda.
This post covers both parliamentary and presidential elections, but since it specifically targets presidential candidates during the prohibition period, it violates Article 55 t).
27606559912324043
This is clearly electoral propaganda because: - Contains CMF number - Directly targets presidential candidates - Makes electoral promises/criticisms - Calls for voting action - Paid advertisement with wide reach
TRUE
ION-MARCEL CIOLACUNEGATIVE NICOLAE-IONEL CIUCĂNEGATIVE
USR
USR Constanța, pentru incalcarea articolului 55 t) din Legea 370/2004, prin publicarea și promovarea unei reclame pe Facebook (ID: 27606559912324043) ce conține propagandă electorală după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie, criticând direct candidații prezidențiali Marcel Ciolacu și Nicolae Ciucă, cu scopul de a influența comportamentul electoral al votanților. Postarea, efectuată după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, conține număr CMF (11240015), demonstrând caracterul său electoral explicit, și a fost promovată către un public țintă de 100,001-500,000 persoane, reprezentând o încălcare clară a prevederilor legale privind încheierea campaniei electorale.
